relation: No AEM forms equivalent – investigate SAP Interactive Forms by Adobe
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {811=The Adobe Central Output Server family is scheduled to reach end of life on June 30, 2016. Adobe AEM forms is the recommended replacement for most Central products. AEM forms’ capabilities extend engaging web and mobile experiences to enterprise forms and documents, allowing organizations to complete complex digital interactions while improving user experiences, increasing efficiency and responsiveness, and extending business reach. }
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {8196=The Central Output Server family is scheduled to be discontinued on June 30, 2016. Following Adobe enterprise support policies, customers on any Central product version 5.7 or 5.7.1, or Web Output Pak 2.0.7, will be able to purchase extended support contracts through June 30, 2016. Support services will remain consistent with previous generations, including access to technical support resources and software patches., 38876=Copyright © 2015 Adobe Systems Incorporated. Maintenance & Support (M&S) will be included inthe annual term cost of AEM forms. To qualify, customers must have a valid Platinum M&S contract for Central Pro Output Server, Central Output Server, Central Workstation Edition, or Web Output Pak. Customers will receive overlapping support for their Central family product and AEM forms (basic) until June 2016., 8975=Version 5.7 generation products will be available for sale to existing customers through June 2016, making it possible to purchase new licenses or expand existing installations as needed to support immediate business requirements. Version 5.7 generation products are defined as Central Pro Output Server 5.7, Output Pak for mySAP.com 5.7, Output Designer 5.7, and Web Output Pak 2.0.7.}
textBeforeTable: Which Central Output Server family products are suitable for an AEM forms migration? The Adobe Central Output Server family is scheduled to reach end of life on June 30, 2016. Adobe AEM forms is the recommended replacement for most Central products. AEM forms’ capabilities extend engaging web and mobile experiences to enterprise forms and documents, allowing organizations to complete complex digital interactions while improving user experiences, increasing efficiency and responsiveness, and extending business reach.  Why should I consider moving to Adobe® Experience Manager (AEM) forms? Migrate to Adobe® Experience Manager (AEM) forms Showcase Upgrade Tools Modules Overview
textAfterTable: AEM forms is a Java-based server and runs on most operating systems that support that platform, including Microsoft® Windows®, AIX®, Solaris™, and Linux®. SAP Interactive Forms by Adobe http://www.sap.com/solution/lob/sales/software/interactive-forms/index.html Forms Designer is included with AEM forms basic; it does not need to be purchased separately. Customers migrating will receive AEM forms basic. What is the migration offer? Adobe is offering a reduced price exchange of certain Central family product licenses for AEM forms (basic) term licenses. Maintenance & Support (M&S) will be included inthe annual term cost of AEM forms. To qualify, customers must have a valid Platinum M&S contract for Central Pro Output Server, Central Output Server, Central Workstation Edition, or Web Output Pak. Customers will receive overlapping support for their Central family product and AEM forms (basic) until June 2016. Does AEM forms offer identical functionality to Central products? AEM forms is comparable, but not identical, to products in the Central Output Server family. Its robust architecture and extended capability set are designed for organizations that want to make the most of today's best-in-class enterprise architectures and on-demand business processes. AEM forms contains virtually all the capabilities of Central Output Server and a great deal more. Migrating customers will get enhanced output functionality and added features that will allow them to create, manage, and publish
